title: Testimonial
description: TOP 3 TRUST SIGNAL - Customer testimonial with quote, attribution, optional star ratings, and company logos. Critical social proof component that builds credibility and drives conversions by showing real customer success.

marketingContext.purpose: Social proof and credibility building through authentic customer stories
marketingContext.conversionImpact: Critical - Testimonials are one of the top 3 trust signals. 72% of customers won't take action until they read reviews (BrightLocal). Video testimonials build 53% more trust than text (Wyzowl).
bestPractices: Use SPECIFIC results in quotes: '127% increase in revenue' > 'increased revenue significantly'
Include full attribution: name + title + company = credibility
Add customer photos for authenticity (67% more trust with photos)
Show star ratings when available (5-star testimonials are 3x more effective)
Display company logos to leverage brand recognition
Add verification badges ('Verified Customer', 'Real Review') to increase trust by 15%
Use 3-5 testimonials minimum (social proof increases with quantity)
Prioritize video testimonials when possible (53% more trust than text)
Place testimonials near CTAs and on high-intent pages (pricing, product pages)
Rotate featured testimonials to highlight different benefits
abTestRecommendations: Quote length: Short (1-2 sentences) vs. Long (3-5 sentences)
Attribution: Name only vs. Name + Title + Company
Visual: With photo vs. Without photo
Ratings: With stars vs. Without stars
Results highlighting: Bold numbers vs. Plain text
Video: Video thumbnail vs. Text-only quote
psychologyPrinciples: Social Proof: People follow others' actions, especially in uncertainty
Authority: Job titles and company names add credibility
Specificity: Concrete numbers ('127%') are more believable than vague claims
Recency: Fresh testimonials (with dates) perform better
Similarity: Testimonials from similar industries/roles resonate more

quote.description: The testimonial text/quote (REQUIRED). Use SPECIFIC results and concrete benefits. Avoid vague claims.
examples: This product increased our revenue by 127% in just 3 months.
We saved 10 hours per week on manual tasks. The ROI was immediate.
Our customer satisfaction score jumped from 3.2 to 4.8 stars in 6 weeks.
The best investment we made this year. Cut our costs by 35% while improving quality.
Game-changing for our team. We closed 40% more deals in Q1.

requirements: Star ratings have visually hidden text ('5 out of 5 stars')
Star rating also has role='img' with aria-label
Customer avatar has descriptive alt text (customer name)
Company logo has descriptive alt text (company name)
Expand button has aria-expanded state for screen readers
All interactive elements meet 44x44px touch target minimum
Color contrast meets 4.5:1 for text, 3:1 for UI elements
Focus states clearly visible with 2px outline, 2px offset
accessibility.keyboardNavigation: Video thumbnails and expand buttons are keyboard accessible with visible focus states

optimizations: Pure CSS - no JavaScript required (except optional expand functionality)
Inline SVG stars (no external icon requests)
Minimal DOM nesting for fast rendering
Lazy loading on customer photos and company logos

breakpoints.mobile: Smaller avatar (2.5rem), full-width logo, vertical layout
breakpoints.desktop: Larger featured variant, inline layouts possible

behavior: Inline variant stacks vertically on mobile (<768px)
Company logo goes full-width below author on mobile
Featured variant padding reduces on mobile (xl → lg)
Quote font size reduces on mobile for featured variant

darkMode.support: Full dark mode support with semantic color tokens
features: Automatic color switching via CSS custom properties
Card background adapts to dark surface color
Featured gradient adjusted for dark mode
Quote mark opacity reduced for better contrast
Logo brightness increased in dark mode
Verification badge colors inverted for dark mode
All text colors maintain WCAG AA contrast in dark mode

dos: Use specific, measurable results ('127% increase' not 'big increase')
Include full attribution (name + title + company) when possible
Keep quotes conversational and authentic (avoid corporate speak)
Use recent testimonials (add dates if showing older ones)
Show diverse customers (different industries, company sizes, roles)
Use customer photos (real photos, not stock images)
donts: Don't use vague claims ('great product', 'highly recommend' alone)
Don't fake testimonials or use stock photos as customers
Don't omit important context (e.g., timeframes, conditions)
Don't use testimonials that are too old (refresh regularly)
